question: Posted By Anne on June 14, 1999 at 12:26:27My husband is 48 years old (uncircumsized) and I am 36. He has a rather short penis.  We are first time newly weds of 2.5 years.  Two years ago he was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. We have been trying to conceive on and off since our marriage in 1997.  Many times we give up out of frustration becasue he has so many sexual function problems.  He was recently diagnosed (by his primary care physician)as having Peyronie's Disease and has an appointment with a specialist in a few weeks.  In addition, he has trouble with a lack of sensitivity on his penis.  Intercourse is not as easily satisfying for him as oral sex.  We have sooooo many questions and concerns since we are really wanting to have children.  Please help. There seems to be so much working against us.  This has been very discouraging and very hard on our marriage.1)Does Peyronie's Disease or the length of the penis effect male fertility?2)Is surgery the best rememdy?3)How do we know how much, if any of this, is related to his diabetes?4) Is there anything we can do to heighten penis' sensitivity?5)Is Peyronie's Disease in any way related to scleroderma?  I was recently diagnosed with localized scleroderma...contagious?Thank you very much for any help.Follow Ups:Re: Diabetes/Peyronies Disease/Erection Maintenance/Size/Infertility...all related Jeff 6/16/1999(0)Re: Diabetes/Peyronies Disease/Erection Maintenance/Size/Infertility...all related Daryl Bahr 6/15/1999(0)
